snippet: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif announced plans early Thursday to set up military courts to deal with terrorism cases after a deadly Taliban attack on a school in Peshawar last week....

headline.print_headline: Pakistani Premier Announces Military Courts for Terrorism Cases
headline.main: Pakistani Premier Announces Military Courts for Terrorism Cases

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif announced plans early Thursday to set up military courts to deal with terrorism cases after a deadly Taliban attack on a school in Peshawar last week.
abstract: Pakistan Prime Min Nawaz Sharif, in first public address since Taliban attack on school in Peshawar, vows to set up military courts for terrorism cases and crush militancy; government will also strengthen existing laws, develop new counterterrorism force and prevent banned groups from operating under different name.
